original: Johansson, Johan Viktor, fil. dr, förste bibliotekarie, sekreterare, Göteborg, f. 22/12/88 i Hammar, Örebro 1., av insp. Gustaf J. o. Hilma Carlström. G. 1. 15-22 m. Signe Bruno; 2. 23 m. Märta Wåhlin. Barn: Klas f. 16, jur. kand. Mats 25, fri. stud., Siv 28. — Mogrex. 08, fil. kand. i Gbg 13, fil. lic. 19, fil. dr 27. E. o. aman. v. Gbgs stadsbibi. 15, aman. där 16, andre bibi. 19, förste dito sed. 30. Aman. v. Gbgs högsk. exped. 17, högsk. sekr. 22, tf. sekr. v. Gbgs handrhögsk. 23-28, sekr. i VVS 38, led. av o. sekr. i styr. f. Oceanograf. inst. i Gbg 38 o. komm. f. den med. und :visn. v. Gbgs högsk. 40. Skr.: Den förromant. balladen i Sv:e (12), Gbgs högsk. matrikel 91-16 (tills. m. L. Wåhlin 16), Études sur Denis Diderot (27), Extra Posten 1792-95 1-2 (36), Vem var sign. von K? (36), Gbgs högsk. fonder (39), Va-riantex. av Stiernhielms Ulfilas-ed. (39), Gbgs stadsbibi. handskr :saml. (41), Minnestal hållna i Gbgs vet skåps- o. vitterhetssamh. 38-42 (42), Verner von Heidenstam (43), Försvar f. boksamlaren (43), Snoilsky som bib-liofil (45), Katalog över Gbgs stadsbibi. Viktor Rydbergs-utställn. (45), Torgny Segerstedt (46), Variantex. o. tryckteknik (47), art. o. rec., bidr. t. Sv. biogr. lex. m. m., redig. o. utg. bl. a. Bokvandningar (45), Svenska bibiioteik (46), J. A. Wadman, Valda dikter (46). Hobby: boksamlande. RNO, RVO, LVVS.
translated: Johansson, Johan Viktor, PhD, First Librarian, Secretary, Gothenburg, born December 22, 1888, in Hammar, Örebro county, son of inspector Gustaf J. and Hilma Carlström. Married 1st to Signe Bruno (1915-1922); 2nd to Märta Wåhlin in 1923. Children: Klas (born 1916), Mats (born 1925), and Siv (born 1928). Completed his Bachelor of Arts degree in 1908, Bachelor of Philosophy at University of Gothenburg in 1913, Licentiate of Philosophy in 1919, and Doctorate of Philosophy in 1927. Assisted librarian at Gothenburg city library in 1915 and became a librarian in 1916. In 1919 became the second librarian and in 1930 became the first librarian. Also served as assistant secretary at the University of Gothenburg in 1917 and was appointed secretary in 1922, temporarily serving as secretary of the Gothenburg School of Business from 1923 to 1928. Secretary of The learned Society of Gothenburg in 1938, and member and secretary of the Board of the Oceanographic Institute in Gothenburg in 1938 and the medical under: orship committee of the University of Gothenburg in 1940. Author of "The Pre-Romantic Ballad in Sweden" (1912), "University of Gothenburg Register 1891-1916" (1916) with L. Wåhlin, "Studies on Denis Diderot" (1927), "Extra Posten 1792-95 1-2" (1936), "Who was Sign. von K?" (1936), "University of Gothenburg Funds" (1939), "Variantex. of Stiernhielm's Ulfilas Edition" (1939), "Gothenburg City Library Manuscript Collection" (1941), "Memorial Speeches Held in the Learned Society of Gothenburg and the Society of Literature and Knowledge in 1938-1942" (1942), "Verner von Heidenstam" (1943), "Defense for the Book Collector" (1943), "Snoilsky as a Book Collector" (1945), "Catalog of Gothenburg City Library Viktor Rydberg Exhibition" (1945), "Torgny Segerstedt" (1946), "Variantex and Printing Techniques" (1947), articles, reviews, contributions to the Swedish Biographical Dictionary, etc., edited and published, among others, "Bokvandningar" (1945) and "Svenska Bibliotek" (1946), J.A. Wadman, Selected Poems (1946). Hobby: book collecting. Awards: Royal Order of the North Star, Royal Order of Vasa, and member of the learned Society of Gothenburg.

structured.name: Johan Viktor Johansson

structured.description: Johan Viktor Johansson (1888–) was a Swedish author and librarian.
